description:
If I pass invalid availability zone to the run instance command, it doesn't give error message.

Availability zone command
$euca-describe-availability-zones
AVAILABILITYZONE nova available


RunInstance command
$euca-run-instances -k project2.test -t m1.tiny ami-vdfo75za -z nova1

Expected Result: It should give error message.
title: RunInstances: Invalid availability zone doesn't give error message

comments.content:
If I pass invalid availability zone to the run instance command, it doesn't give error message.

Availability zone command
$euca-describe-availability-zones
AVAILABILITYZONE nova available


RunInstance command
$euca-run-instances -k project2.test -t m1.tiny ami-vdfo75za -z nova1

Expected Result: It should give error message.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~tpatil

comments.content:
In fact it doesn't give an error message, in my case it just starts the instance alright:

$ euca-run-instances ami-5li5ojc3 -k mykey -t m1.tiny -z novaz
RESERVATION	r-ambq46kg	IRT
INSTANCE	i-00000004	ami-5li5ojc3			scheduling	mykey (IRT, None)	0		m1.tiny	2011-01-27 13:16:59.674081	unknown zone
$ euca-describe-instances 
RESERVATION	r-ambq46kg	IRT
INSTANCE	i-00000004	ami-5li5ojc3	10.0.0.4	10.0.0.4	running	mykey (IRT, stardust)	0		m1.tiny	2011-01-27 13:16:59.674081	nova
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: Zone placement is ignored in nova.scheduler.chance.ChanceScheduler (the default scheduler), that's why it doesn't block for me. Which scheduler are you using ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
I am using default scheduler.

This is not implemented in the nova.scheduler.chance.ChanceScheduler and if we are not going to support it in future, then we can mark this bug as Invalid.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~tpatil
